bibl.title: Letter from G. Jameson Carr to Henry Rose Carter, June 16, 1925

div1.p: Carr refers to the diseases O Bicho and Schistomiasis Mansonii.

div1.head: Letter from G. Jameson Carr to Henry Rose Carter, June 16, 1925
div1.opener:
154
PRAÇA 1817 N.o 181
CAIXA POSTAL, N.o 41
DEPARTAMENTO DE SAÚDE PUBLICA
COMMISSÃO DA FEBRE AMARELLA
PARAHYBA DO NORTE -- BRASIL
June 16th. 1925.
Dear Dr. Carter:.
div1.p:
Your letter requesting information about “O Bicho”
arrived in the midst of closing down the Parahyba Post and therefore this
is merely an acknowledgement of your kindness in asking me.

I have not personally seen Schistomiasis Mansonii in Parahyba but have
been told it exists; so also in the states of Para and Alagoas where I
have Bacteriologist friends.

I am proceeding to Rio Grande Do Norte on the 18th. and will meet there
two other men who have had ample opertunity to observe the entire coast
and will write to you more fully all that I can hear and see.

The “Ordeal by Lemon” I have heard of from the common people but they
attributed curative powers to it, which can be understood,
This I know of Parahyba, the same snail is here in quantity that is
the host in the cases reported from Para.

I am looking forward with the keenest anticipation to having the
privilege of meeting you in Washington for without your kindly
encouragement I would not have had the heart to continue the
work of investigation but would have been a pure “Mata- Mosquito”
and a scientific training is not necessary to this end, witness the
splendid results obtained by my good friend Hale in Bahia than which
nothing could have been finer.

With my very best respects
believe me to be Sir
div1.closer:
yours sincerely G. Jameson Carr. Dr H.R. Carter M.D.
2122 California St. N.W.
Washington D.C.
United States of America.
